abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Petroleum Resources
            Joint Venture Project for Pakistan was satisfactory. The
            project achieved its main objective, sustainability is
            likely, and both the Bank and Borrower performed
            satisfactorily. Two main lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, it is important to structure government
            policy, with regard to pricing and contractual agreements,
            to be compatible with the practices of the international
            industry in order to ensure that the government is
            successful in attracting private sector participation in the
            development of the domestic industry. Lastly, in every
            project, time or schedule delay is important and impacts the
            economic and financial results of the project, especially
            with exploration and development programs. Care must be
            taken to ensure that procurement procedures are compatible
            with both industry standards and Bank guidelines.
